img.alt: Public Notice to Participate in the April 20 Board of Education Meeting

div.div: Public Notice to Participate in the April 20 Board of Education Meeting

On April 20, 2020 at 6:30 p.m., the Lakota Local School District Board of Education will hold its regular meeting virtually. The live stream will be available by clicking the video link included for this meeting located on our Boarddocs page.

a.title: Public Notice to Participate in the April 20 Board of Education Meeting

div.a: Read More About Public Notice to Participate in the April 20 Board of Education Meeting

img.alt: Parade of Graduates - Call for Photo Submissions

div.div: Parade of Graduates - Call for Photo Submissions

Besides graduation, another important right of passage for Lakota's seniors is the “Parade of Graduates,” which has traditionally brought many of our graduates back to the elementary school where their schooling started. While we are making plans to reschedule some of the other traditional senior milestones closer to the new graduation dates, this is one event that we have decided to reimagine in a virtual format.

a.title: Parade of Graduates - Call for Photo Submissions

div.a: Read More About Parade of Graduates - Call for Photo Submissions

div.div: After learning that Xavier University has cancelled all events until August, we have identified an alternative location to recognize our graduates. We are pleased to announce that the graduation ceremonies for the Class of 2020 will be held at Lakota East and West high schools.
div.a: Read More About Lakota Reschedules, Relocates Graduation Ceremonies

div.div: During a time when the preferred classroom setting is not an option, Zoom has quickly become Lakota’s go-to tool for keeping staff and students connected. In the district’s first seven days of remote learning, teachers and staff used the video conferencing tool to collectively host more than 1,600 meetings that were attended by more than 10,000 individuals.
div.a: Read More About Lakota Staff 'Zoom' into Remote Learning

img.alt: VIDEO: Lakota Experts Share Mental Health Tips

div.div: VIDEO: Lakota Experts Share Mental Health Tips

Lakota’s emphasis on social, emotional and mental health has become even more pronounced as students and staff start to feel the toll of our recent break in routine. In addition to the resources, tips and guidance Lakota experts are sharing with their families to help guide them through this pandemic, Lakota is sharing brief video messages from our full range of mental health experts.

a.title: VIDEO: Lakota Experts Share Mental Health Tips

div.a: Read More About VIDEO: Lakota Experts Share Mental Health Tips

img.alt: Morning Announcements Go Virtual Too, Add Routine and Normalcy

div.div: Morning Announcements Go Virtual Too, Add Routine and Normalcy

All across Lakota, students are starting their school days at home no different than they would if they were at school. While morning announcements are taking on a slightly different format than normal, they are still being used to take care of business and most importantly, set the tone for the day ahead.

a.title: Morning Announcements Go Virtual Too, Add Routine and Normalcy

div.a: Read More About Morning Announcements Go Virtual Too, Add Routine and Normalcy

img.alt: Plains Junior Students Meet ‘Face-to-Face’ with a NASA Scientist

div.div: Plains Junior Students Meet ‘Face-to-Face’ with a NASA Scientist

Lakota teachers are bringing unique learning opportunities to students, all possible due to our new remote learning environment. Case in point: last week Plains Junior eighth graders got to speak ‘face-to-face’ with a NASA scientist.

a.title: Plains Junior Students Meet ‘Face-to-Face’ with a NASA Scientist

div.a: Read More About Plains Junior Students Meet ‘Face-to-Face’ with a NASA Scientist

img.alt: Submit Alternative Transportation Requests for Next School Year by July 20

div.div: Submit Alternative Transportation Requests for Next School Year by July 20

To ease the transition to a new school year and honor families’ requests for alternative pick-up and drop-off locations for transportation, Lakota is asking that families submit transportation forms by July 20.

a.title: Submit Alternative Transportation Requests for Next School Year by July 20

div.a: Read More About Submit Alternative Transportation Requests for Next School Year by July 20

img.alt: Lakota March Madness Basketball Tournament Update

div.div: Lakota March Madness Basketball Tournament Update

The Lakota March Madness Basketball Tournament has been cancelled due to the recommendations and guidance of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, the Ohio Department of Health and the Butler County Health Department.

a.title: Lakota March Madness Basketball Tournament Update

div.a: Read More About Lakota March Madness Basketball Tournament Update

div.div: Everything WE do is designed to provide a future-ready, student-centered learning experience for every single child.
